name: The Songs in My Head Quiz | Country Music | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Maybe life has got you run down 
I think it's time, girl, that we slow down 
So take a look it's almost sundown 
So why don't you lay right here 
Let me just ease your mind 
I'm givin' you all my time 
And I'm gonna keep on, keep on, lovin' you" 

The song is called "Keep on Lovin' You".  Which duo made this their first hit?
options: Jaron & The Long Road to Love
questions.explanation:
Steel Magnolia.

	"Keep on Lovin' You" was the first release for the group Steel Magnolia. The duo of Meghan Linsey and her fiancee Joshua Scott Jones was able to take the up-tempo song to number four on the US Country Billboard chart. The song debuted on most charts in September 2010.

questions.text:
"You make me smile like the sun, fall out of bed
Sing like bird, dizzy in my head
Spin like a record, crazy on a Sunday night
You make me dance like a fool, forget how to breathe
Shine like gold, buzz like a bee
Just the thought of you can drive me wild
Oh, you make me smile"

Which artist sang this song, which appeared on both the country and pop charts?
questions.explanation:
Uncle Kracker.

	"Smile" was a hit on the country and pop boards for Uncle Kracker. It was his first release since 2004, and was well-received.  It made the charts in Canada, US, UK, Australia and Germany. The biggest success was on the pop side as the song went to number two on the US Adult Pop Singles Billboard Chart.

questions.text:
"Music's playing up and down the block
Mostly Christian, blues, country, folk, and southern rock
It's a little piece of paradise way out here in the woods
There's always something going on down in the trailerhood"

You can find Carl and Jane in the Trailerhood in whose song?
questions.explanation:
Toby Keith.

	"Trailerhood" was the 50th release for Toby Keith, and the first off his album "Bullets in the Gun". The song did not perform as well as other Toby Keith singles, peaking only at number 19 on the Billboard country charts.

questions.text:
"We never spoke a word 
But every thought she had I heard from across the room 
We were standing face to face 
I couldn't find the words to say give me one more move 
I don't even know her name 
I guess foolish pride's to blame"

Which band and guest singer fall in love "As She's Walking Away"?
questions.correct: Zac Brown Band with Alan Jackson
questions.explanation:
Zac Brown Band with Alan Jackson.

	The first song featuring the Zac Brown Band and someone else proved to be a good one. The group, along with country legend Alan Jackson, won the Grammy for Best Country Collaboration with Vocals at the 2010 Grammy Awards. The song reached number one on the US Billboard country charts in late November 2010.

questions.text:
"Well the truth, well it hurts to say
I'm gonna pack up my bags and I'm gonna go away
I'm gonna split, I can't stand it
I'm gonna give it up and quit and ain't never coming back
Girl, but before I get to going, I've got to say,
I know you used to love me but that was yesterday,
And the truth, I won't fight it,
When the love starts burning you got to do what's right."

Who sang the song "Lover, Lover"?
questions.explanation:
Jerrod Niemann.

	Despite the song sounding new, the song was the same as the 1992 Sonia Dada tune "You Don't Treat Me No Good", just with a different title. It was Dada's first release, just like Niemann's. The song reached number one for Niemann in August of 2010. Niemann performed the song nine times, all singing different lines before overlapping them. All of the "backup singers" on the track are actually Niemann.

questions.text:
"Absolutely no one that knows me better
No one that can make me feel so good
How did we stay so long together?
When everybody, everybody said we never would
And just when I, I start to think they're right
That love has died..."

Who was "Stuck Like Glue"?
questions.explanation:
Sugarland.

	"Stuck Like Glue" was the first release off "The Incredible Machine" for Sugarland. The song was released on July 23, 2010 in the United States, while January 31, 2011 in the UK. The song reached number two on the US Billboard Country charts.

questions.text:
"Said her name was a hand me down name
From the side of a family that long ago came
Over here on a boat from somewhere in Spain
Sounded to me just a little bit strange, I guess.
But I have to admit
It felt good on my lips."

Whose lips is the song talking about?
questions.explanation:
Tim McGraw.

	The song was released in late 2010, and debuted at number 33 on the Billboard Country charts.  It was one of the highest debut positions in Tim's career.

questions.text:
"I woke up again this morning
And wouldn't you know it? Pouring rain!
I went and burned a pot of coffee
And like us I poured it down the drain
'Cause I didn't know I needed you so
And letting you go was wrong
And baby I know you got your radio on
So this is my bad, come back song"

What former "Blowfish" sings "Come Back Song"?
questions.explanation:
Darius Rucker.

	Rucker released "Come Back Song" in July of 2010, and it hit number one on the Billboard Charts on November 6th. At the time, it was his fourth number one hit, on only his fifth released song. He was a founding member, lead singer, and guitarist in the band Hootie and the Blowfish. Between country and pop, Rucker released an R&B album in 2002.

I'm just a guy who wishes that I could be your man someday
Yeah a picture paints a thousand words it's true

I wanna put you in a melody; I gotta set you to a groove"

Who wants to "Put You in a Song"?
questions.explanation:
Keith Urban.

	"Put You in a Song" was released in September 2010. The song was the first release off Keith's album "Get Closer".

questions.text:
"I really hate to let this moment go, 
touching your skin and your hair falling slow,
When a goodbye kiss, feels like this"

Which former American Idol winner teamed up with Jason Aldean in "Don't You Wanna Stay"?
questions.explanation:
Kelly Clarkson.

	The duo performed the song at the 2010 CMA Awards to a standing ovation. Clarkson's main genre has been pop/rock, but she made her second foray into country, after singing "Because of You" with Reba McEntire in 2007.
